alert.note: Alert for Avoyelles; Rapides (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 03 at 10:15AM CST until January 03 at 11:45AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CST THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN AVOYELLES AND CENTRAL RAPIDES PARISHES... At 1015 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rainfall has ended across the area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen in a short period earlier this morning and flooding will continue to recede this morning. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Alexandria, Pineville, Glenmora, Effie, Lecompte, Kolin, Poland, Ruby, Libuse, Centerpoint, Esler Regional Airport, Holloway, Deville, Woodworth, Forest Hill and Mcnary. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
